title: Classic Courtroom Dramas
description: Order in the court! Test your knowledge of the greatest legal thrillers and courtroom dramas from classic cinema.

questions.question: In '12 Angry Men' (1957), Henry Fonda plays Juror #8 who holds out for acquittal. How many jurors initially vote guilty?
Gregory Peck played the noble lawyer Atticus Finch in which 1962 film based on a Harper Lee novel?
In 'Witness for the Prosecution' (1957), which legendary actress plays the wife who testifies against her husband?
Which actor played the defense attorney in 'Anatomy of a Murder' (1959)?
'Judgment at Nuremberg' (1961) depicted trials of which country's war criminals?
Spencer Tracy starred as the judge in 'Judgment at Nuremberg.' Who played the lead German defendant?
In 'Inherit the Wind' (1960), the courtroom drama is based on which real-life trial?
Who directed '12 Angry Men' (1957) as his feature film debut?
In 'A Few Good Men' (1992), Jack Nicholson delivers the famous line 'You can't handle the truth!' Who is he speaking to?
Charles Laughton starred as a cunning barrister in 'Witness for the Prosecution.' The film was based on a story by which author?
In 'To Kill a Mockingbird,' Atticus Finch defends a Black man falsely accused of which crime?
Paul Newman played a down-and-out lawyer who takes on a medical malpractice case in which 1982 film?
Which 1959 courtroom drama featured a jazz score by Duke Ellington?
In '12 Angry Men,' the jurors deliberate during which kind of weather?
Maximilian Schell won the Best Actor Oscar for his role as a defense attorney in which 1961 film?
